channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2018 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Documents detail alleged lies Manafort and Cohen told publicly and to investigators. Here's what else we know.
item.description: Everyone's lying to Robert Mueller -- and he knows it.

item.title: Analysis: Donald Trump's very bad day
item.description: On Friday, President Donald Trump (and the rest of us) got the most fulsome look into the inner workings of special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation yet. And what Trump saw has to terrify him.

item.title: Feds: Cohen broke the law at Trump's direction
item.description: Federal prosecutors Friday requested that the court impose "a substantial term of imprisonment" for Donald Trump's former personal attorney Michael Cohen.

item.title: Burnett: Mueller drops a major bomb on Trump
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett examines revelations detailed in separate filings by special counsel Robert Mueller and the Southern District of New York, on Donald Trump's former personal attorney Michael Cohen.

item.title: Mueller: Manafort lied about 5 key things
item.description: Special counsel Robert Mueller's description of Paul Manafort's breach of his plea agreement will largely be secret, a federal judge said on Friday.

item.title: Kellyanne Conway's husband trolls Trump's tweet
item.description: Attorney George Conway, husband of White House counselor Kellywanne Conway, responded to President Trump's tweet that said "totally clears the President" shortly after prosecutors filed sentencing documents against Paul Manafort and Michael Cohen.

item.title: Comey refuses to answer key questions behind closed doors
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey is testifying Friday before members of Congress behind closed doors, setting the stage for him to spar with Republicans who have investigated the agency's probes into Hillary Clinton's private email server and Russian interference in the 2016 election.

item.title: What happens if Trump committed a felony?
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett discusses the court filings from the Southern District of New York with her panel and what happens if President Donald Trump did, in fact, commit a felony.

item.title: Opinion: Mueller is dropping big clues about Trump
item.description: President Trump and his allies have long rallied around the defiant battle cry that special counsel Robert Mueller is conducting a "witch hunt" that has uncovered "no collusion" with Russia. But public filings by Mueller and the Southern District of New York over the past two weeks have changed the game. We still do not know everything Mueller knows, but the contours of a broad scheme by the administration to conspire with Russia -- to the personal benefit of Trump and the detriment of the United States -- are now coming into sharper focus.

item.title: This justice began the Supreme Court's conservative transformation
item.description: When Chief Justice John Roberts rebuked President Donald Trump over judicial independence in November, some critics countered with a 2010 moment between President Barack Obama and Justice Samuel Alito.

item.title: Trump names Gen. Mark Milley to be new Joint Chiefs chairman
item.description: President Donald Trump on Saturday nominated Army Chief of Staff Gen. Mark Milley to be the next chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

item.title: Kelly no longer speaking to Trump and is expected to resign soon, sources say
item.description: John Kelly is expected to resign as White House chief of staff in the coming days, two sources familiar with the situation unfolding in the West Wing tell CNN.

item.title: What we know about the unresolved NC race
item.description: North Carolina elections officials as well as local and state prosecutors are investigating allegations of fraud that could involve tampering with or suppressing absentee ballots in a close congressional race there.

item.title: Trump calls Tillerson 'dumb as a rock'
See Tillerson's stunning Trump rebuke
item.description: President Trump lashes out at his former Secretary of State Rex Tillerson calling him "dumb as a rock" in a tweet following an interview Tillerson did with CBS where he called Trump "undisciplined."

item.title: Analysis: Trump brand now toxic in Putin's Kremlin
item.description: Gatherings of world leaders are often about the absence of substance. Several news cycles from now, few will remember what was discussed at the recent G20 summit in Buenos Aires.

item.title: Opinion: Will the GOP turn on Trump?
item.description: Court filings on Friday regarding Paul Manafort and Michael Cohen reveal the ways in which the special counsel's investigation can endanger President Trump's future. Special Counsel Robert Mueller also revealed on Tuesday that former national security adviser Michael Flynn offered "substantial assistance" to the Russia investigation -- the same day Maryland and the District of Columbia issued subpoenas in their emoluments case against President Trump.

item.title: Analysis: Trump's favorite pollster was the least accurate in the midterms
item.description: First things first: The theme song of the week is the theme to Love, American Style composed by Charles Fox and Arnold Margolin.

item.title: Man arrested in North Carolina teen's abduction and killing
item.description: A man in detention on unrelated charges has been arrested in the kidnapping and killing of 13-year-old Hania Aguilar, who was abducted last month outside her home in southeastern North Carolina.

item.title: Father of slain teen denied visa to attend her funeral
item.description: When 13-year-old Hania Aguilar is laid to rest in North Carolina on Saturday her father will be nearly 3,000 miles away.

item.title: Stampede at rap concert in Italy kills 6
item.description: At least six people are dead and dozens wounded following a stampede at an Italian nightclub, the country's Civil Protection Agency said.

item.title: More than 20 million in path of major winter storm in the South
item.description: A major winter storm is threatening to deliver snow, ice and flooding across much of the United States over the next few days.

item.title: Can this 'email killer' translate worldwide?
item.description: Emoji, timestamps and local keyboards. These are just some of the things Slack had to worry about as it brought its workplace communication platform overseas.

item.title: Salvini holds 'Italians first' rally in Rome
item.description: Far-right Italian Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini attacked same-sex unions and promised to put "Italians first" during a rally in Rome on Saturday, as his government remained locked in deadlock with the EU over its proposed budget.

item.title: Police detain hundreds in Paris protests
item.description: French police detained more than 340 people in Paris on Saturday as the city locked down ahead of another weekend of violence during protests by the "gilets jaunes" or "yellow vests" anti-government movement.

item.title: Woman dies from brain-eating amoeba after using tap water in her neti pot
item.description: A Seattle woman rinsed her sinuses with tap water. A year later, she died of a brain-eating amoeba.

item.title: Teen sentenced for helping girl hang herself
item.description: A Utah teenager who helped a girl hang herself last year was sentenced Friday to between five years and life in prison as part of a plea deal.

item.title: Watts' mother-in-law: Thank God he didn't take my advice on one thing
item.description: The parents of Shannan Watts are speaking out for the first time since their son-in-law Chris Watts was sentenced to life in prison for killing their daughter and two granddaughters.

item.title: Cyntoia Brown must serve 51 years before she's eligible for release, court says
item.description: A woman who was 16 when she killed a Nashville man who solicited her for sex must serve at least 51 years in prison before she's eligible for release, according to the Tennessee Supreme Court.

item.title: Egypt investigating couple pictured nude on top of pyramid
item.description: A video uploaded recently to social media that shows a foreign couple climbing to the summit of the Great Khufu Pyramid of Giza and a still picture that shows them in a naked embrace has sparked outrage among Egyptians, state media Ahram Online said Friday.

item.title: UFC may have found its next Ronda Rousey
The worst Heisman Trophy winners ever
Actress makes waves in acceptance speech
item.description: During an award acceptance speech, actress Viola Davis called on Hollywood to create more "authentic" roles for actresses of color.

item.title: CEO: Crazy to work more than 40 hours a week
item.description: If you didn't know better, you'd think Jason Fried is more of a slacker than a CEO.

item.title: 'Jeopardy!' contestants baffled by CNN question
item.description: All three contestants on an episode of "Jeopardy!" could not name a show that airs on CNN.

item.title: Winners and losers from surprising NBA trade
He could be the answer for spurned Yankees
Man seen with backpacker to be charged with murder
item.description: The case of the 22-year-old British backpacker in New Zealand has gone from a missing persons case to a murder investigation, according to Auckland City Police.

item.title: Central Park duck's star continues to rise
item.description: What the duck?! Central Park's Mandarin duck has become an even bigger celebrity. Jeanne Moos has this duck redux.

item.title: Star pays off more than $430K in layaways
item.description: Tyler Perry is spreading holiday cheer in his city of Atlanta.

item.title: Doctor Says Carbs Are Not The Problem (This Is)
How Gilda Radner shaped 'SNL' and changed the course of comedy
item.description: Gilda Radner -- one of the most influential cast members in "Saturday Night Live" history -- played a pivotal role in shaping "SNL," forever changing the course of comedy.

item.title: Inside the rise of a dope comedy queen
How 'SNL' star creates her celebrity impressions
item.description: For more comedy, watch CNN Films' "Love, Gilda," the story of legendary comedian Gilda Radner, New Year's Day at 9 p.m. ET/PT.

item.title: Photos: 30 groundbreaking women in comedy
Opinion: American comedy's white-guy problem
Oprah's favorite gifts just made your holiday shopping even easier
Budget-friendly tech gifts to give this season
Amazon's 12 days of deals continues here's what to shop
Opinion: Kevin Hart just doesn't get it
item.description: It hasn't been a great couple of weeks in the press for comedian Kevin Hart. Last week, he and his wife were slammed and accused of racism on social media for a cowboys and Indians-themed birthday party for his son, which he refused to apologize for.

item.title: Grammy nominations bring singer to tears
item.description: Nominations for the 61st Grammy Awards were announced Friday and one of the nominees was brought to tears live on television.

item.title: SpaceX's latest rocket makes a wet crash landing
item.description: A Falcon 9 rocket attempting to land ended up in the ocean when it encountered a technical issue after a successful mission into orbit.

item.title: The week in 25 photos
item.description: Take a look at 24 photos of the week from November 30 through December 6.

item.title: His decision to test his DNA changed his life. Now he wants to change yours
item.description: Othman Laraki's decision to test his DNA changed his life -- and his career.

item.title: These $12 'perfect' socks are for a good cause
item.description: The founders of Bombas sought to create a company that would solve one of the biggest problems homeless people face a need for socks.

item.title: She never went to college. Now her business brings in millions
item.description: Christina Stembel used to think flowers were a waste of money. But when the economy spiraled into a recession, she started seeing things differently.

item.title: The real reason for Trump's shakeup
item.description: In the olden days of presidential appointments and nominations, the focus was justifiably on the nominees -- their background, what their policy positions said about the role they would play in an administration and whether or not they would get confirmed.

item.title: Facebook can run, but it can't hide for much longer
item.description: The UK Parliament published more than 200 pages of internal Facebook documents and communications on Wednesday after employing a series of bold and unprecedented moves against the social media company. The revelations in the documents only add to mounting reports of Facebook's questionable practices, which will no doubt lead to additional government inquiries.

item.title: Telling young women to stay in their lane is sexist
item.description: Jameela Jamil is on a mission to combat airbrushing, diet teas and other forms of image-based oppression, but not everyone is on board. The outspoken actor and presenter is best known for her role as the aggravatingly perfect, name-dropping former activist Tahani on NBC's "The Good Place."

item.title: Rex Tillerson breaks free of the 'big boss'
item.description: Faced with new court filings by special counsel Robert Mueller, who is investigating his ties to Russia and other matters, our Distractor-in-Chief began Friday with a burst a tweets and two big nominations. As President Donald Trump proposed William Barr for attorney general and Heather Nauert for ambassador to the United Nations, he seemed intent on capturing our attention. It didn't work.

item.title: Priyanka Chopra: The complicated feminist
item.description: "Feminism is just saying give me opportunities without judging me for the decisions that I make, the same freedom that men have enjoyed for so many centuries," Priyanka Chopra explained in an interview last October.

item.title: Pearl Harbor brought out the best in George Bush
item.description: It's an accident of timing that the funeral of George H. W. Bush occurred within days of the anniversary of Pearl Harbor. But it's no accident that Americans have marked the passing of the former President with an outpouring of respect and admiration typically reserved for war heroes. They remember his presidency, to be sure, but they recall in a deeper way his generation of Americans, a generation indelibly stamped by the attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, and the war that followed.

item.title: How To Pay Off Your House ASAP (It's So Simple)
Transfer your debt and pay no interest until 2020
Motley Fool Issues Rare "Ultimate Buy" Alert
Analysis: Elizabeth Warren's heritage revelation was as bad as you thought it was
item.description: When Elizabeth Warren unveiled a 5-minute video aimed at putting to rest questions as to whether she actually was Native American in mid-October, it was, um, not well-received. It turns out that the damage done to Warren's political prospects in 2020 was significant, and has forced her allies to consider more drastic methods to take the issue off the table.

item.title: George Papadopoulos released from prison
item.description: Ex-Donald Trump campaign aide George Papadopoulos was released from prison Friday morning after serving 12 days for lying to investigators about his contact with individuals tied to Russia during the 2016 campaign.

item.title: For Trump, Bush farewell is a first look at what presidential veneration could be
item.description: As he listened to military choirs and honor guards venerate George H.W. Bush on Wednesday, President Donald Trump found himself contemplating the vast scale of the job he holds --and wondering how his own legacy might compare.

item.title: Celebrities step in after Trump slashes Obamacare ad budgets
item.description: The Trump administration isn't doing much to let Americans know it's time to sign up for Obamacare, so celebrities are trying to fill the void.
